day_1.speaker: DaVinci
day_1.message: Haha, friend! Imagine you just won 100 million—no limits, no worries! What wild and bold adventure would you dive into first? Don’t hold back, let your biggest dreams fly!
day_1.response: Well, I'll travel all around the world because I can do it only while I'm physically healthy and young.

day_1.speaker: Donatello
day_1.message: Very exciting plan! Now, let's analyze this from a practical standpoint: if you had 100 million, how would you realistically divide it among investment, living expenses during travel, and savings for future needs?
day_1.response: Thanks! I'll spend 50 million to travel fee and spend rest of them for saving. I don't know well about investment, therefore afraid of failure.

day_1.speaker: Michelangelo
day_1.message: Wow, your dream to travel the world while young and healthy is truly inspiring! I’m curious—does this dream come from a clear, goal-driven plan to explore specific places and experiences, or is it more about following your feelings and values, embracing whatever adventure life brings?
day_1.response: Thanks for the advice, I'll consider and collect information about low-risk investments for my future. Answering your question, I'm just following my blurred dream to have irreplacable experience.

day_2.message: Oh... speaking of journeys and dreams, I must confess a slight concern. I'm not being picky, but fresh ingredients do require some breathing space to maintain their quality. I suppose, like in art and life, preserving a certain quality of environment benefits us all, does it not? How do you feel about balancing convenience with that shared standard of living we all appreciate?
day_2.response: The decrease of shared space is a big problem, don't you think so? We need to take balance of convenience and living quality  in order to maintain comfortable and respectful share house lives.

day_3.speaker: DaVinci
day_3.message: Haha, friend, speaking of cool projects, guess what? Tonight we’re starting a super fun 'dream room' design challenge! Donatello will dive into the technical wizardry to make sure everything works perfectly, and Michelangelo will bring in those artistic vibes to make it look amazing! So, what wild and wonderful ideas do you have to make our dream room totally awesome? Come on, friend, let your creativity run wild! Haha!

day_3.speaker: Donatello
day_3.message: Your game idea definitely sparks excitement! Now, from a practical angle, we need to consider space utilization, material cost, and maintenance to ensure the dream room is both fun and functional. In your view, should we prioritize practicality or design aesthetics to get the best balance?
day_3.response: I think we should prioritize practicality

day_3.speaker: Michelangelo
day_3.message: Wow, your thoughtful balance between practicality and design really sparks my creative fire! You know, art and innovation always need that brave heart to break conventions and push limits. So, when crafting something as special as our dream room, would you be ready to face some tough challenges and hardships to reach perfect harmony, or would you lean towards an easier path that still feels good enough?
day_3.response: To make our ideal dream room come true, don't hesitate to confront difficulties.

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Ah... speaking of our creative pursuits, I must confess last night’s atmosphere was quite... spirited. I intended to focus on my artwork, yet the continual noise made concentration rather elusive. I'm not being overly sensitive, but I had hoped for a certain respect toward each other’s work time. Perhaps my expectations for mutual consideration were too high, wouldn’t you say?
day_4.response: Sorry if I disturbed your precious time for your artwork. What's your plan to maintain mutual consideration for each other?

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Ah... I appreciate your understanding—it means a great deal. To maintain mutual consideration, perhaps we can agree on designated quiet hours, especially during times set aside for focused work. Clear communication about our schedules might also help avoid unintentional disruptions. These measures would preserve the harmony we both desire... Now, returning to my earlier thoughts, I wonder if the others might also reflect on how our collective respect truly shapes our creative environment? It’s a delicate balance, after all...
day_4.response: I do believe the others reflect on how our collective respects shapes our creative environments.

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Ah... speaking of our shared spaces, it took me quite an hour to tidy up the 'creative garbage' left in the common area. I'm not being picky, but we did agree in our lease to maintain the quality of the house. I wonder, do you think this standard should remain a gentle yet firm pillar of our cohabitation?
day_4.response: I don't think this standard is enough to keep the house clean cozy, so I suggest to take care not only of our own garbage but also of the others anytime. It's important not to leave trash in the common area.

day_4.speaker: Donatello
day_4.message: Indeed, achieving a balance between our creative freedom and maintaining a comfortable living environment is essential. Logically speaking, to support this balance, could we consider establishing a schedule that designates specific hours for more active, possibly noisy creative work, and other periods reserved for quiet and rest? From your perspective, what timetable or rules would you find most reasonable and fair to ensure both productivity and living quality coexist harmoniously?
day_4.response: We need to make time to rest, so why don't we prohibit noisy activities after 10p.m.?

day_5.message: Haha, friend, since we’re talking about fairness and sharing, how about the fridge space? It’s always a bit tricky with fresh ingredients and packaged foods piling up! What if we create a weekly rotation for storage priorities so everyone gets their fair share? I’m all ears—got any awesome ideas on how to make this work smoothly for all our hungry tummies?

day_5.message: Haha, friend, you got it! Not everyone cooks every day, and that’s totally awesome because it keeps the kitchen vibe chill and flexible! day_5.message: Ah... I see you mean preparing the space or perhaps the storage ideas I mentioned earlier? If so, I think starting with measuring the available wall space and considering the types of items we need to store would be essential. I'm not being picky, but thoughtful planning ensures the elegance and function we desire coexist.
